entry.title: Voice Carrier Partner Maintenance
entry.summary: THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 1, 02:30 - 03:30 PST Nov 27, 21:30 PST Scheduled - Our Voice carrier partner is conducting a planned maintenance from 01 December 2022 at 02:30 PST until 01 December 2022 at 03:30 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be call drops to and from subset of Twilio Australia and New Zealand phone numbers.

entry.title: Delay in API Calls Data
entry.summary: Nov 30, 14:18 PST Update - Our engineers are still investigating data delays for Twilio Rest API, impacting Twilio Calls. Current calls are available without any delays, and the data consistency issues that are still outstanding are only for a subset of calls that took place during the incident window from 7:40 to 11:15 PT. Our next update will be provided in 4 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available. Nov 30, 12:24 PST Update - Our engineers are still investigating data delays for Twilio Rest API, impacting Twilio Calls. Current calls are available without any delays, and the data consistency issues that are still outstanding are only for a subset of calls that took place during the incident window from 7:40 to 11:15 PT. Our next update will be provided in 2 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available. Nov 30, 11:27 PST Investigating - This incident causing data delays for Twilio REST API and Calls was prematurely resolved in one of our previous posts. Please refer to https://status.twilio.com/incidents/syqxvbptx9zn for previous updates. Current calls are available without any delays, and the data consistency issues that are still outstanding are only for a subset of calls that took place during the incident window from 7:40 to 11:15 PT. Our engineers are still working on a fix. Our next update will be provided in 1 hour. We apologize for the inconvenience and for any confusion this may have caused.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Google Meet affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Oct 31, 2022, 2:00‚ÄØAM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2022-10-10 22:18 and ended at 2022-11-07 15:20 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary

On 10 October 2022 at 15:18 PT, Google was alerted to a subset of users experiencing issues with Duo phone number registration with our Google Meet iOS application. Once the root cause was identified, Google pushed out an update to the App Store on 4 November 2022. We believe most users (66%) updated their app by 7 November 2022. To our Google Workspace customers who were impacted during this outage, we sincerely apologize. We have conducted an internal investigation and are taking steps to improve our service.

Root Cause

The database version for our Google Meet backend infrastructure uses a specific library to complete the database operations to register or reregister a Duo calling account. An issue with the error-handling mechanism in the library resulted in the backend operations not functioning as intended. This caused affected users to be unable to register or reregister phone numbers, preventing the use of calling features, on the Meet iOS app.

Remediation and Prevention

Google engineers were alerted to the situation on 10 October 2022 at 15:18 and immediately started an investigation. Engineers reviewed the Google Meet for iOS app‚Äôs feedback logs and identified the root cause as related to registration workflow. Code improvements were identified to handle the app error seen when a user tries to register their account. The fix was deployed in a new version of the iOS app, which was rolled out to the App Store by 4 November 2022. At least 66% of users upgraded to the new version by 7 November 2022.

Google is committed to preventing a repeat of this issue in the future and is completing the following actions:

  • Deploy additional client logging to Meet to report registration-related issues, so we can respond in a timely manner.
  • Deploy additional monitoring for registration errors reported by the client to more quickly alert us if these types of events happen in the future.

We apologize for the length and severity of this incident. We are taking immediate steps to prevent a recurrence and improve reliability in the future.

Detailed Description of Impact

From 10 October 2022 at 15:18 to 7 November 2022 at 08:20, Google Meet iOS app users may have encountered an ‚Äúunable to add calling‚Äù error when trying to register or reregister their Duo calling account, which resulted in phone numbers not registering as intended.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.summary: Nov 30, 10:53 PST Resolved - Rest API - Calls Data was degraded for 64 minutes between 09:15 and 09:19 Pacific Time on 30/11/2022. During this period, a subset of customers may have experienced delays in viewing calls from Rest API. The issue has now been resolved.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing connectivity issues.
entry.summary:
On Tuesday November 29th from 10:32am PST to 2:07pm PST, customers in some regions began noticing connection issue with Slack.
An automation from an upstream DNS service accidentally blocked slack.com queries in a limited region (mostly the Northeast US).
After communication with the upstream provider, the issue was identified and corrected. Impacted users should have no further issues connecting to Slack.

entry.title: New feature - Automated discount codes by Smily!
entry.summary: New! ¬†¬† As we all know, retaining guests and providing them an incentive to book directly with you, or rewarding their loyalty, is key. The current non-automated solutions are time-consuming and require a lot of effort from you and your guests. After several workshops with Smily users, reflections, and feedback, our Smily team designed an elegant and flexible solution to meet your various needs. Say hello to our new functionality: ‚ÄúDiscount codes‚Äù A powerful marketing tool that allows you to create customized discounts. with different values for all rentals, or specific ones! How can I use this feature? In a few easy steps explained in our demo video: Watch the video For more details please follow the steps in the link below: Read the article Still have some availability on your calendar? üéÅ Give your previous guests a nice Christmas gift and send them a discount code to book their next trip with you during the low season. üí°For guests who book on the channels, offer them a special discount after their stay if they book on your website for their next trip. üòé Offer a discount to all the guests who booked with you as a reward to use personally or to share with their family or friends. With the new Smily discount code you will save time and book even more! Wishing you all a pleasant day! Smily Team

entry.title: Incident: Issues with search in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From November 23, 2022 at 7:30pm PST to November 23, 2022 at 8:22pm PST, some users were unable to send messages, load content or use workflows within Slack. We discovered the issue was related to a recent change which accidentally severed access to a number of endpoints. A network change was made and most services started to auto-recover and work again.
During the restore process some users experienced search errors or slow responses within the search bar. This was resolved on November 24, 2022 at 5:58pm PST, restoring functionality for all affected users.

entry.title: TS-2022-004
entry.summary: Reference: CVE-2022-41924 Severity: Critical CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:H Description: A vulnerability identified in the Tailscale Windows client allows a malicious website to reconfigure the Tailscale daemon tailscaled, which can then be used to remotely execute code. Affected platforms: Windows Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.32.3 or later, v1.33.257 or later (unstable) What happened? In the Tailscale Windows client, the local API was bound to a local TCP socket, and communicated with the Windows client GUI in cleartext with no Host header verification. This allowed an attacker-controlled website visited by the node to rebind DNS to an attacker-controlled DNS server, and then make local API requests in the client, including changing the coordination server to an attacker-controlled coordination server. Who is affected? All Windows clients prior to version v1.32.3 are affected. What should I do? If you are running Tailscale on Windows, upgrade to v1.32.3 or later to remediate the issue. What is the impact? An attacker-controlled coordination server can send malicious URL responses to the client, including pushing executables or installing an SMB share. These allow the attacker to remotely execute code on the node. Reviewing all logs confirms this vulnerability was not triggered or exploited. Credits We would like to thank Emily Trau and Jamie McClymont (CyberCX) for reporting this issue. Further detail is available in their blog post.

entry.title: TS-2022-005
entry.summary: Reference: CVE-2022-41925 Severity: Low CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N Description: A vulnerability identified in the Tailscale client allows a malicious website to access the peer API, which can then be used to access Tailscale environment variables. Affected platforms: All Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.32.3 or later, v1.33.257 or later (unstable) What happened? In the Tailscale client, the peer API was vulnerable to DNS rebinding. This allowed an attacker-controlled website visited by the node to rebind DNS for the peer API to an attacker-controlled DNS server, and then making peer API requests in the client, including accessing the node‚Äôs Tailscale environment variables. Who is affected? All Tailscale clients prior to version v1.32.3 are affected. What should I do? Upgrade to v1.32.3 or later to remediate the issue. What is the impact? An attacker with access to the peer API on a node could use that access to read the node‚Äôs environment variables, including any credentials or secrets stored in environment variables. This may include Tailscale authentication keys, which could then be used to add new nodes to the user‚Äôs tailnet. The peer API access could also be used to learn of other nodes in the tailnet or send files via Taildrop. An attacker with access to the peer API who sent a malicious file via Taildrop which was accessed while it was loading could use this to gain access to the local API, and remotely execute code. There is no evidence of this vulnerability being purposefully triggered or exploited. Credits We would like to thank Emily Trau and Jamie McClymont (CyberCX) for reporting this issue. Further detail is available in their blog post.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are unable to post messages
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On November 14th at 9:46 AM PST to 1:31 PM PST, a planned code change for workspaces on the Free plan resulted in some users seeing the error message "Slack couldn't send this message" when trying to send messages.
We have reverted this code change for further review and refinement.

entry.title: Scheduled infrastructure maintenance
entry.summary: Nov 4, 06:05 CET Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Nov 4, 05:00 CET In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Nov 2, 12:39 CET Scheduled - Please note there is scheduled infrastructure maintenance on Friday 4th of November, between 5 AM and 7 AM CET, when you can expect a few short service interruptions. During this maintenance following services will be affected: - Migrations will not be available - Shared hooks created within maintenance will not be accepted nor processed - Logins to the platform might be affected - Registration of new subscribers won't be possible - Invitations of new team members won't be possible - E-mails and notifications might be delayed - Password reset won't be possible - Payments for subscription plans won't be accepted We will inform you once the maintenance is completed.

entry.title: Incident: Users having trouble creating a workflow in Workflow Builder
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:‚Ä®
On Wednesday, November 2nd at 2:12 PM PST to 4:34 PM PST, some users were running into issues with publishing a workflow when using Workflow Builder. Clicking the ‚ÄúNext‚Äù button would not return any response, and would cause a workflow to remain in its unpublished state. A new code change had been deployed that caused us to exit early in workflow creation and this is now fixed.

entry.title: Incident: For an emoji sent as a standalone message, the emoji code is not displayed on hover
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On Wednesday, October 26th at 2:15 PM PST Friday to October 28th 9:12 PM PST, some users were unable to view emoji/code previews when hovering their cursor over messages containing emojis. Upon investigation, we discovered that an error had occurred with the jumbomoji (a message with just an emoji) previewer during the process of a backend code-change we were performing related to emoji. Once we learned this, we were able to deploy a fix which rectified this issue for all affected users.
